title: Thoughts on the new HUD
body:
cons
-to large, takes up to much space
-to colourful, its constintly taking my attention away from my game
-change of information positions. I understand that by having most of it near each other it will streamline how we view information but its so far from the original positions and to cluddled together that i have trouble taking reading it
- a huge gap on the left is incredibly annoying to me, would prefer to have the items back their
-information of ally and your stats is way to small, and would prefer it to be on the right of the Champion icon
-the borders, they're to blame for the size and do not blend at all with the map, just a huge eye-sore
-xp bar, and ally health/mana bars, are way too small, and way to far from their original position, to close to the map and score

pros
-i like the new ping bar
-ult timers
-you can change the position of people on the leaderboard

replies.body:
I am a graphic designer and this is my unbiased opinion:

I see where they are trying to go by condensing info into clusters, and that is graphically good for saving space and I'm assuming the reason for this is to give you more room to move the mouse, however clustering information is very bad for readability, it makes info harder and more time consuming to access, an example for this is say if someone gives you a page from a novel, and asks you to find a specific word say for example: 'ocean' even if they tell you its on line 6 it still takes your mind a second to find and separate it from the words around it, and on the other hand if someone gives you a poem and asks to find the word 'ocean' and says its on line 6, you'll find it much easier due to the negative space (whiteness of the page) and only a few bits of other info (words) around it. Of course to fit the same amount of info into a poem that is in a novel you're going to need more pages, or in the case of lol take up more of the screen space (old HUD) but thats much better than having important info being difficult to read. 

also the monotone blue of the menus, HUD and minimap make it feel like there is a haze over the entire screen and it actually is very uncomfortable on the eye.

overall the new HUD is visually more appealing, but the old one is much better for readability and accessibility of information.

so it just comes down to Form over Function. or Function over Form, whichever you prefer, 

obviously RIOT prefers the Form over function option, which is very good on skins and VU's etc but when its information, i think readabiltiy is key.

Totally agree. I prefer function over Form. If you want form, buy skins,  and leave it at that. I heard today that people on 4k monitors find it straining their eyes also.

Everything you just said in cons will be fixed by time and is in the cons section because you havent given it time to settle in...

Give it time. Dont be so impatient and quick to judge.

I was talking about this with friends and we talked about the idea of being able to move the various sections of the new HUD around the map, and i believe this would be a great idea. I could move the information to positions where i can more easily read them, and anyone who has their own preferences to where they want them.
It would work almost the same to how you move the leaderboard and shop, but id prefer it with an option button, so i dont move my shit while panicking
I wanna vote but my opinion leads to yes i love it and no i hate it so my vote is a its ok (up vote this if you think its ok but there are things wrong with the new HUD)
